name: solifluction
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the gradual movement of saturated (= very wet) soil down the side of a hill or mountain in very cold regions: There is some evidence of slope degradation by solifluction under a cold climate. Problems of solifluction and frost cracks are common to many sites in this Arctic region.
More examplesFewer examplesAs temperatures decline during cold periods, solifluction is known to have increased.This soil distribution may be an original feature, or may be a result of solifluction.Solifluction terraces are present on some of the higher plateaux.
